NCES 9401 Schools and Staffing Survey (SASS) Papers Presented at Meetings of the American Statistical Association
This publication consists of a collection of papers presented at: (1) The Meeting of the American Statistical Association: Section on Survey Research Methods, August 1992 (2) The American Statistical Association Conference on Establishment Surveys, June 1993 (3) The Meeting of the American Statistical Association: Section on Survey Research Methods, August 1993 and; (4) The Meeting of the American Statistical Association: Social Statistics Section: August 1993 		7/31/1994
NCES 9402 Generalized Variance Estimate for Schools and Staffing Survey (SASS)
This study looked at the data gathered during the 1987-88 Schools and Staffing Survey (SASS) which was a nationl survey of elementary and secondary schools. The target populations for the SASS were school administrators (principals and heads), and classroom teachers in public and private elementary/secondary schools. The survey design consisted of two parallel but essentially separate schemes, one for the public schools and one for the private (nonpublic) schools. The components of SASS were (1) Survey of Teacher Demand and Shortage (TDS), (2) Survey of Schools (3) Survey of School Administrators, and (4) Teacher Survey. Approximately 13,000 schools and administrators, 65,000 teachers, and 5,600 Local Education Agencies (LEA's) composed the SASS sample 		7/31/1994
NCES 9403 1991 Schools and Staffing Survey (SASS) Reinterview Response Variance Report
This reinterview measured response variance of selected questions from the 1991 SASS administrator, school, and teacher questionnaires. 		7/31/1994
NCES 9404 The Accuracy of Teachers' Self-reports on their Postsecondary Education: Teacher Transcript Study, Schools and Staffing Survey
This study is a methodological study designed to determine the best method for obtaining information on teachers' backgrounds. Specifically, two alternative research methodologies will be compared: the collection of teachers' self-reports of their academic qualifications, as provided on survey questionnaires, and the use of teachers' college transcripts. Transcripts are assumed to ultimately provdie the most accurate and complete descriptions of teachers' backgrounds, since they are not subject to potential reporting bias of teachers who may wish to inflate their qualifications, and they provide a degree of detail that might not be possible when dependent on teachers' recall: however, the collection and analysis of transcripts is administratively more complex than the administration of a survey questionnaire. 		7/31/1994
NCES 9405 Cost-of-Education Differentials Across the States
This work was the first to control for degree status and experience when examining the geographic differences in teachers' salaries. It laid the conceptual framework for the Chamber's later work on creating geographic cost-of-education indices. 		7/31/1994
NCES 9406 Six Papers on Teachers from the 1990-91 Schools and Staffing Survey and Other Related Surveys
This working paper consists of six papers by different authors, all focusing on teachers from the 1990-91 SASS and other related surveys. 		7/31/1994

Brochure describes the National Household Education Survey; its breadth and frequency. 		7/30/1994

NCES 94434 CD-ROM: School District Data Book for 1990 Census Data for 15,000 School Districts
This product provides data on the social and economic characteristics of school-age children and their families by school district. It also includes data from the Common Core of Data, and financial information from the Census of Governments as well as extensive software for data extraction, tabulation, and mapping. 		7/15/1994
NCES 94386 Descriptive Summary of 1989-90 Beginning Postsecondary Students: Two Years Later: 90-92
This report will describe what has happened to students in the first two years after entering postsecondary education. This report will include information concerning current enrollment status, persistence in or completion of postsecondary education, intention of and preparation for entry into graduate school, financing postsecondary education, labor force participation both during and after postsecondary enrollment, family development, and civic participation. 		7/15/1994

A methodological report which evaluates the quality of "Schools and Staffing Survey" procedures and data. 		7/12/1994

This briefing book presents state by state data from 1991 SASS consisting of state tables, graphics and charts highlighting differences and similarites between the states. The book will contain about 45 tables on various topics including teacher salaries, graduation requirements, school climate, etc. 		6/30/1994

NCES 94337 E.D. TAB: Characteristics of Stayers, Movers, and Leavers: Results from the Teacher Follow-Up Survey, 1991-92
The data presented will include characteristics of teachers who left the teaching profession between school years 1990-91 and 1991-92 (leavers), teachers who changed schools during that period (movers), and teachers who stayed in the same school (stayers). 		5/20/1994
NCES 94471 Adult Education: Employment-Related Training
This study is focused on the employed adult education participants. It examines their course-taking patterns (job- and career-related training) and analyzes the differences among adults of varying characteristics. 		5/11/1994

NCES 94405 Characteristics of the 100 Largest Public Elementary and Secondary School Districts in the United States: 1991-92
This publication provides descriptive information about the 100 largest school districts in the United States in the 1991-92 school year. Almost one in every four public school students in this nation is served by one of these large districts. They are distinguished from smaller districts by characteristics in addition to sheer size, such as pupil-teacher ratios, high school graduates, and minority enrollment as a proportion of total enrollment. 		5/7/1994
NCES 93372 Access to Early Childhood Programs for Children at Risk
Using NHES:91 early childhood data, this report will address two major issues: 1) the extent to which disadvantaged and disabled children currently have access to early childhood programs, by type of disadvantage or disability; and 2) whether disadvantaged and disabled children have access to the same quality programs as do other children. The population to which this study will be generalized will be the population of (resident) U.S. children 3 to 5 years of age as of January 1, 1991. 		5/6/1994

NCES 93699 Language Characteristics and Schooling in the United States, A Changing Picture: 1979 and 1989

NCES 93292 Digest of Education Statistics, 1993
The Digest is an annual compendium whose primary purpose is to provide a compilation of statistical information covering the broad field of American education from kindergarten through graduate school. The Digest includes more than 400 tables from many sources, both government and private, and draws especially on the results of surveys and activities caried out by NCES. The publication contains information on a variety of subjects in the field of education including educational attainment, federal funds for education, and numbers of schools, colleges, teachers and students. 		10/1/1993
NCES 93328 E.D. TAB: Public Elementary and Secondary Schools and Agencies in the U.S. and Outlying Areas: School Year 1991-92
This Common Core of Data Report provides information about the number of types of public schools and education agencies in the U.S. Student membership is tabulated, for States and the U.S. total, by school size and school grade range. Data are presented on pupil/teachers ratios and such student characteristics as racial/ethnic status and eligibility for free lunch. 		10/1/1993

NCES 93275 Adult Literacy in America: A First Look at the Findings of the National Adult Literacy Survey
This report provides a first look at the results of the National Adult Literacy Survey, a project funded by the U.S. Department of Education's National Center for Education Statistics and administered by Educational Testing Service, in collaboration with Westat, Inc. It provides the most detailed portrait that has ever been available on the condition of literacy in this nation -- and on the unrealized potential of its citizens. 		8/30/1993

NCES 93290 The Condition of Education, 1993
The Condition of Education is an annual compendium report to Congress which describes the current status and recent progress of education in the United States. It focuses on 60 indicators, representing a consensus of professional judgment on the most significant national measures of the condition and progress of education at the time, but tempered, necessarily, by the availability of current and valid information. 		7/18/1993
NCES 93458 Current Elementary and Secondary Expenditures - 1990's and Beyond
Factors influencing elementary and secondary current expenditures are examined. One factor influencing current expenditures is the state of the economy with the better the economy, the greater the expenditures. The expected increase in enrollments would act to press expenditures upward. 		7/14/1993
NCES 93459 School Enrollment Expected to Surpass Historic All-Time High
The expected future trend in elementary and secondary enrollment is examined utilizing the recent Bureau of the Census population projections based on the 1990 Census. One important finding is that in 1996, enrollment in elementary and secondary schools is expected to reach an all-time high. 		7/14/1993
NCES 93146 Schools and Staffing in the U.S.: A Statistical Profile, 1990-91
This is a descriptive report focusing on public and private school data from the 1990-91 SASS. It will include analyses of significant relationships among teacher, principal, school, and TDS attrition and shortages, and teacher and principal qualifications. 		7/13/1993

This is a description of the 1991 SASS sample design including stratification, allocation, weighting, imputation and variance estimation. 		7/12/1993

This report will discuss teacher supply and demand issues and present descriptive statistics on aspects of teacher supply and demand. In addition, several models for explaining teacher attrition will be developed and tested. 		7/8/1993
NCES 93461 Modeling Teacher Supply and Demand, with Commentary
This research and development report describes an effort undertaken to model teacher supply and demand, using logistic regression. It includes commentary from substantive and technical experts on the validity of the modeling effort. 		6/23/1993
NCES 93451 Adult Education: Main Reasons for Participating
This report discusses the main reasons for participating in adult education. These reasons are analyzed according to age (shows education is a lifelong process), sex, parental status, race/ethnicity and level of educational attainment. 		6/23/1993

NCES 93169 State Higher Education Profiles: Combined Fifth and Sixth Editions

NCES 19933156 The National Longitudinal Study of the High School Class of 1972: Annotated Bibliography of Studies, 1980-1992.
The National Longitudinal Study of the High School Class of 1972 (NLS-72) is the "grandmother" of the longitudinal studies designed and conducted by the National Center for Education Statistics, and is probably the richest archive ever assembled on a generation of Americans. Participants were selected as high school seniors in 1972 and were followed through postsecondary transcripts in 1984. In 1981, Samuel Peng assembled a bibliography of studies describing or using NLS-72 data. This publication extends Peng's work by describing the considerable number of studies published since the first bibliography. Works are arranged in the following categories: (1) general descriptions (data sets and populations); (2) methodology; (3) work (employment); (4) secondary education; (5) postsecondary education; (6) educational and occupational aspirations; (7) educational and occupational attainment; (8) gender and racial-ethnic differences; (9) vocational technical and vocational education; (10) teachers; (11) marriage, family, and life transitions; (12) economics of education; (13) testing; (14) others; and (15) tabulations. In all, 259 sources are listed and annotated with a brief description of the study and its methodology. Publication of this document coincides roughly with the release of an optical data disk with the NLS-72 data archive, manuals, and sample computer programs. (SLD) 		4/12/1993
NCES 93265 Data File: NAEP 1992 Trial State Assessment in Mathematics Almanacs
Tables and variables by NAEP's traditional reporting areas. 		4/8/1993
NCES 93262 NAEP 1992 Mathematics Report for the Nation and the States Executive Summary
Executive Summary from the 1992 NAEP Trial State Assessment in Mathematics. 		4/8/1993
NCES 93260 NAEP 1992 Mathematics Report Card for the Nation and the States
Overall results - means and percentiles, anchor points and achievement levels in math for the nation for grades 4, 8 and 12 including trends from 1990-1992. Also, for the states for grades 4 and 8. 		4/8/1993
NCES 93421 Interpreting NAEP Scales
Various past, current and possible future methods of interpreting data from NAEP. 		4/8/1993
NCES 93445 Mathematics Report for the States: 1992 Trial State Assessment
The prototype text that will surround computer-inserted data for each state. The state reports will present overall student performance and a context for understanding differences in mathematics proficiencies. 		4/8/1993
NCES 93297 E.D. TAB: Public Libraries in the United States: FY 1991
This will be an E.D.TAB for data collected through the Federal/State Cooperative System for Public Library Data (FSCS). Data will be aggregated at the State and national levels. 		4/5/1993

They are distinguished from smaller districts by characteristics in addition to sheer size, such as pupil-teacher ratios, high school graduates, and minority enrollment as a proportion of total enrollment. 		4/1/1993

NCES 93076 Student Financing of Graduate and First-Professional Education
This report profiles graduate and first-professional students enrolled in postsecondary institutions in 1989-90 and describes their education expenses, the sources and types of financial aid they received, the composition of their aid awards, and the availability of other sources of financial support, such as their own and spouse's earnings and savings and assistance from parents and friends. 		3/15/1993

NCES 92192 Federal Support for Education: Fiscal Years 1980 to 1992
This report analyzes trends in Federal funds for education. 		2/18/1993

This tape will include data from some 4000 academic libraries in postsecondary institutions in the U.S., collected biennially through IPEDS. 		2/16/1993

NCES 93149 What are the Most Serious Problems in Schools? (Issue Brief)
Are schools providing a safe haven in which learning can occur? Concern over this question led to the establishment of the sixth education goal, "By the year 2000, every school in America will be free of drugs and violence and will offer a disciplined environment conducive to learning." The Schools and Staffing Survey (SASS), conducted by NCES in 1987-88 and 1990-91, asked teachers and principals their view of problems in their schools. 		1/30/1993
NCES 93194 Pocket Projections: Projections of Education Statistics to 2003
This brochure contains a summary of projections of enrollments, graduates, classroom teachers, and expenditures at both the elementary and secondary and higher education levels. Projections are presented for year 2002-2003. Actual values for 1980-81 and 1991-92 are also presented. 		1/26/1993
NCES 93442 120 Years of American Education: A Statistical Portrait
This publication contains statistical trends of elementary, secondary, and higher education institutions. Text and charts describe historical shifts in educational attainment, enrollment, staff, degrees and finance. 		1/19/1993

NCES 92097 Digest of Education Statistics, 1992
The Digest is an annual compendium whose primary purpose is to provide a compilation of statistical information covering the broad field of American education from kindergarten through graduate school. The Digest includes more than 400 tables from many sources, both government and private, and draws especially on the results of surveys and activities caried out by NCES. The publication contains information on a variety of subjects in the field of education including educational attainment, federal funds for education, and numbers of schools, colleges, teachers and students. 		11/6/1992
NCES 92129 Dropout Rates in the United States: 1991
Using CPS data, this 4th annual report to Congress by NCES presents data for 1991 on high school dropout and retention rates. The report also examines high school completion rates. Event, status, and cohort dropout rates will be presented. Dropout trends from the 1960's until present will be examined by race, sex and region. 		9/16/1992

NCES 92042 Characteristics of At-Risk Students in NELS:88
Using NELS:88 Base Year data this report will document the size of the At-Risk population in the eighth grade cohort. This report will identify the factors associated with At-Risk students and highlight the characteristics of this At-Risk population. Family characteristics such as SES, parent education, and parent participation in student activities will be examined. Student variables will include: single parent, limited English proficiency, sibling dropped out, school absences and tardiness, test scores, handicapping conditions, etc.This publication has new title - old title "Portrait of the At-Risk Eighth Grader. 		8/11/1992

Parental opinions about the child's school, parental aspirations for the child, parental involvement with the school and parental plans for financing postsecondary education will each be highlighted.Original Title - NELS:88 Base Year Parent Descriptive Report. 		8/4/1992

Parental opinions about the child's school, parental aspirations for the child and parental plans for financing postsecondary education will each be highlighted. 		7/30/1992

It will include analyses of school climate, teacher attrition, and shortages and teacher/administrator qualifications.Original Title - Schools and Staffing Survey: Base Year Report, 1987-88 -- Teacher Demand and Shortage, Schools Administrators, and Teachers. 		7/23/1992
NCES 92099 Overview of the NHES Field Test
A series of four to five reports will describe the design of the Field Test of the NHES, the data collection experiences associated with the conduct of the Field Test, and the findings from several methodological studies conducted as a part of the Field Test. The reports will present information on the response rates of the NHES, the effectiveness of oversampling minorities, multiplicity sampling, and proxy reporting. 		7/16/1992

NCES 92096 The Condition of Education, 1992
The Condition of Education is an annual compendium report to Congress which describes the current status and recent progress of education in the United States. It focuses on 60 indicators, representing a consensus of professional judgment on the most significant national measures of the condition and progress of education at the time, but tempered, necessarily, by the availability of current and valid information. 		7/6/1992
NCES 92084 USER'S MANUAL: NELS:88 First Follow-Up School Component Data Files
This manual will be produced to familiarize data users and others with the procedures followed for data collection and processing of the National Education Longitudinal Study first follow-up survey, and to provide necessary documentation for use of the school data file.Contents will include an overview of the study and historical perspective on the longitudinal studies program, information about related studies and data files, a description of data collection instruments, a description of the sample design and implementation, an account of data collection, preparation and processing. In addition, a detailed guide to the data file and codebook will be provided, including information on the construction of the composite variables, guidelines for use of statistical analysis packages, and record layout, as well as presenting the codebook itself and the survey instruments. 		7/6/1992

NCES 91663 Inventory and Overview of Higher Standards and Their Effects on Elementary and Secondary Students
Review of literature since 1983 on effects of higher education standards on student enrollment, persistance, graduation rates and academic achievements. 		6/30/1992

NCES 92486 A Profile of American 8th Grade Mathematics and Science Instruction
Using NELS:88 data, this analysis report will describe the general characteristics of NELS:88 eighth graders' math and science teachers, as well as characteristics of instruction in their classes. Because it is based on a probability sample of U.S. eighth graders and their schools, generalizations can be made to the nation's eighth grade schools. General class variables such as class size, achievement level, number of LEP students, amount of homework assigned, textbook uses, topic coverage and time spent on various tasks in the classroom will be examined. Teacher and student background characteristics may also be studied as predictors of student achievement in math and science. 		6/24/1992
NCES 92021 NCES Statistical Standards
This document contains the revised technical standards and guidelines for the National Center for Education Statistics (NCES) and an updated and consolidated version of the NCES legislation. 		6/22/1992
NCES 92031 E.D. TAB: Public Elementary and Secondary Schools and Agencies in the U.S. and Outlying Areas: School Year 1990-91
This Common Core of Data Report provides information about the number of types of public schools and education agencies in the U.S. Student membership is tabulated, for States and the U.S. total, by school size and school grade range. Data are presented on pupil/teachers ratios and such student characteristics as racial/ethnic status and eligibility for free lunch. 		6/19/1992
NCES 92050 E.D. TAB: Salaries of Full-Time Instructional Faculty on 9- and 10-Month and 11- and 12-Month Contracts in Institutions of Higher Education, 1980/81 - 1990/91
Data file from the IPEDS salaries and benefits survey, academic year 1990-91 -- contains salaries data of full-time instructional staff. 		6/11/1992
NCES 92066 School Effects on Educational Achievement in Mathematics and Science: 1985-86 National Assessment of Educational Progress
The research on "school effectiveness" indicates that differences among schools can affect student achievement. The National Assessment of Educational Progress collects data on school characteristics, but no previous studies have attempted to link these data to student performance. This study will look at the relationship between science and mathematics achievement in grades three, seven and eleven and two types of explanatory variables: student level variables (i.e., gender, race/ethnicity, and socioeconomic status) and school level variables (e.g., student body composition, fiscal and physical characteristics of the school, school program structure, school academic standards, and principal and teacher characteristics). 		6/11/1992

NCES 1992354 NLS-72-Postsecondary Education Transcript Files. Data User's Manual for Revised Transcript, Term, and Course Files. Supplementary Addendum.
This addendum describes the nature, rationale, and results of the second cleaning and revision of the National Longitudinal Study of 1972 (NLS-72) Postsecondary Education Transcript Files (PETS). This project, conducted for nearly 3 years, followed an initial cleaning and reduction in 1987, which came about as a reaction to the idiosyncratic records originally submitted by institutions. In this revision, the STUDENT file was left as revised in 1987, but the other files underwent considerable alteration. Four data sets with Statistical Analysis System extensions have resulted: (1) STUDENT3; (2) TRANS4; (3) TERM4; and (4) COURSE4. These include the work of the 1987 revisor P. Knepper. The revised definitions, new terminology, and renamed and altered files are described. Directions for using the modified NLS PETS files are included. (SLD) 		4/22/1992

NCES 92479 Language Characteristics and Academic Achievement: A Look At Asian and Hispanic Eighth Graders in NELS:88
Using NELS:88 base year data, student language proficiency, home language and academic achievement of Asian and Hispanic eighth graders will be examined. The students' and their parents' literacy in their first language, as well as their English language ability will be studied, along with other family characteristics such as parental education and aspirations, SES, length of residence in the U.S. and education in other countries. 		2/14/1992

NCES 92011 International Mathematics and Science Assessments: What Have We Learned
This report addresses two related issues. First, it summarizes the past international studies of mathematics and science, describing each study and its primary results. Second, the report draws together critical and inaccessible documentation-information that scientists require to evaluate the quality of the surveys. The report also describes six major international studies of science and mathematics achievement conducted by IEA or IAEP, discusses their findings, and examines the methodologies used in the studies. Finally, the report offers suggestions for improving future studies. 		2/3/1992

NCES 92222 Adult Education Profile for 1990-1991
This brief report represents the first data from NCES' 1991 survey of the educational activities of adults in the United States. This survey was conducted as a large-scale, nationally representative field test and is a component of NCES' National Household Education Survey (NHES). NHES is a random-digit dialing telephone survey of the civilian, non-institutionalized population in the 50 states and the District of Columbia. 		1/15/1992
NCES 92079 E.D. TAB: Detailed Characteristics of Private Schools and Staff, 1987-88
This report on private school education presents data on private schools, teachers, and administrators, as well as school characteristics, and program emphasis, admissions criteria, and graduation/college application rates. 		12/31/1991
NCES 92022 Standards for Education Data Collection and Reporting (SEDCAR)
Initiated to produce data collection and reporting standards through the combined efforts of data providers, producers, and users at the local, state, and federal levels. The standards do not attempt to describe the types of data that should be collected. Rather, they are intended to serve as a guide to the key phases of data collection and reporting. The standards identify the qualities that characterize good measures and describe the process of selecting and evaluating appropriate measures that will result in data of the highest quality--data that provide useful, timely, accurate, and comparable information. 		12/31/1991
NCES 92032 E.D. TAB: Early Estimates for Public and Private Elementary and Secondary Education Statistics: School Year 1991-92
Early estimates of students, teachers, graduates, revenue and expenditures for current 1991-92 school year for public and private elementary and secondary education. 		12/31/1991
NCES 92038 Early Estimates of Higher Education Statistics: 1991
This report presents results from the 1991 IPEDS early estimates survey for institutions of higher education, including national totals on fall enrollment, degree completion, staff, and finance. The data will be presented by the type of institution. 		12/30/1991
NCES 91490 Projections of Education Statistics to 2002
This report provides projections for key education statistics. It includes statistics on enrollment, graduates, classroom teachers, and expenditures in elementary and secondary schools and institutions of higher education. 		12/15/1991
NCES 92082 Diversity of Private Schools
This analysis will test a new typology of Private schools for use in reporting private school data. It will be examined to determine if it discriminates better among schools along several dimensions such as academic emphasis, espoused values, and school characteristics. 		12/15/1991

This report attempts to provide a comprehensive picture of Federal support for education in fiscal year 1965, 1970, 1975, and 1980-1991. 		12/3/1991
NCES 91697 Digest of Education Statistics, 1991
The Digest is an annual compendium whose primary purpose is to provide a compilation of statistical information covering the broad field of American education from kindergarten through graduate school. The Digest includes more than 400 tables from many sources, both government and private, and draws especially on the results of surveys and activities caried out by NCES. The publication contains information on a variety of subjects in the field of education including educational attainment, federal funds for education, and numbers of schools, colleges, teachers and students. 		11/15/1991
NCES 91091 E.D. TAB: Teacher Survey on Safe, Disciplined, and Drug-Free Schools
This report presents statistics on teachers' perspectives of issues related to safety, discipline, and drug use prevention in public elementary and secondary schools. A national sample of 1,350 public school teachers responded to questions concerning the extent of discipline problems within schools and the nature and effectiveness of current policies and drug education programs. Keywords: safety in schools; drugs in schools; discipline in schools 		11/15/1991
NCES 92003 National Postsecondary Student Aid Study: Estimates of Student Financial Aid, 1989-90
The National Postsecondary Student Aid Study (NPSAS) is a comprehensive study that examines how students and their families pay for postsecondary education. It includes nationally representative samples of undergraduate, graduate, and first-professional students; students attending less-than-2-year, 2-year, 4-year, and doctoral-granting institutions. Students who receive financial aid as well as those who do not receive aid, and a sample of students' parents participate in NPSAS. 		10/30/1991
NCES 92371 Data File: National Postsecondary Student Aid Study: FY 1989-90
Data file to be derived from the 1989-90 National Postsecondary Student Aid study--contains information on student financial aid, cost of education, and student characteristics. 		10/30/1991
NCES 91487 Quality of Responses of Eighth Grade Students to Questionnaire Items
Using NELS:88 data, this analysis report will provide a thorough examination of the quality of the data collected through the NELS:88 base year survey and will serve as a benchmark for many future analyses. Assessment of data quality leads to better analysis and interpretation of the data and improvements in the designs of future follow-ups and studies. The report will describe the quality of the NELS:88 base-year data focusing on: 1) validity - parent data used as standard, 2) consistency - agreement between similar responses in different sections of questionnaire and 3) quality of data by student characteristics. 		9/30/1991
NCES 91133 E.D. TAB: Aspects of Teacher Supply and Demand in Public School Districts and Private Schools: 1987-88
This ED TAB presents public school district and private school data on number of continuing and newly-hired full-time equivalent (FTE) teachers, number of FTE teaching positions approved, filled, and unfilled, and teacher salaries (as scheduled) and incentives. 		9/6/1991
NCES 91634 Education Counts: An Indicator System to Monitor the Nation's Educational Health
Final report of the Special Study Panel on Education Indicators for the National Center for Education Statistics 		9/5/1991
NCES 91219 E.D. TAB: Current Funds Revenues and Expenditures of Institutions of Higher Education: Fiscal Years 1980 through 1988
Revenues and expenditures of institutions of higher education are analyzed in several ways: for 2-year & 4-year, public & private institutions; in constant dollars for all institutions from 1980 through 1988; & in current dollars from 1980 through 1988. Revenues and expenditures are presented in categories by State & the percentage change from fiscal year 1987 to fiscal year 1988 is calculated by State for public & private institutions. 		8/27/1991
NCES 91389 Profiles of Faculty in Higher Education Institutions, 1988
This report will describe the distribution of faculty by age, the retirement plan of faculty, and pattern of career paths; will present information about faculty hiring, compensation, faculty activities and workload by race and gender; and describe the extent of part-time faculty and their qualification and work patterns. 		8/21/1991

Title changed to reflect title on Review Form, 6/21/91. EPUBDATE also changed to reflect earlier TDATETOIS (12 wks +7 days). 		8/13/1991
NCES 91396 Classification of Instructional Programs - CIP, 1990 Update
This special report contains the updated descriptions of postsecondary education programs. 		7/31/1991
NCES 91400 State Higher Education Profiles: Third Edition
Annual publication presenting State-by-State indicators from different IPEDS surveys. Fall enrollment, Salaries, Finance and completions. Then data are summarized by State and compared to the data at the national level. 		7/31/1991
NCES 91216 E.D. TAB: Salaries of Full-Time Instructional Faculty on 9/10 Month Contracts, 1979-80 Through 1989-90
This publication provides average 1989-90 salaries of full-time instructional faculty by academic rank, gender, state and level of higher education institutions. 		7/23/1991
NCES 91217 E.D. TAB: Enrollment in Higher Education, Fall 1989
This publication provides 1989 fall enrollment of institutions level and control and by student age, gender and level of study. 		7/22/1991
NCES 91470 Careers in Teaching: Following Members of the High School Class of 1972 - In and Out of Teaching
This report makes use of longitudinal information about the careers of individuals from the high school class of 1972 trained to be teachers. 		7/11/1991
NCES 91128 E.D. TAB: Characteristics of Movers, Leavers, and Stayers: Results from the Teacher Followup Survey, 1988-89
Basic tabulations from TFS survey including demographic and economic characteristics of leavers, movers, and stayers. Information will also be presented on reasons for continuing and leaving teaching. 		7/1/1991
NCES 91141 Key Statistics on Public Elementary and Secondary Education Reported by State & By Regional, Locale, & Wealth Clusters, 1988-89
Reports regional and subregional division characteristics of public el/sec education in the Nation; it also reports characteristics associates with the urbanicity, or the most prevalent of locate, of states, and the relative wealth of states. The factors examined are those most commonly used to a thumbnail sketch of the resources, needs, organization, and special characteristics of education within a State. 		6/26/1991

NCES 91637 The Condition of Education: Elementary and Secondary Education, 1991 Volume 1
The Condition of Education is an annual compendium report to Congress which describes the current status and recent progress of education in the United States. It focuses on 60 indicators, representing a consensus of professional judgment on the most significant national measures of the condition and progress of education at the time, but tempered, necessarily, by the availability of current and valid information. This volume features 30 indicators on Elementary and Secondary Education. 		5/31/1991
NCES 91638 The Condition of Education: Postsecondary Education, 1991, Volume 2
The Condition of Education is an annual compendium report to Congress which describes the current status and recent progress of education in the United States. It focuses on 60 indicators, representing a consensus of professional judgment on the most significant national measures of the condition and progress of education at the time, but tempered, necessarily, by the availability of current and valid information. This volume features 30 indicators on Postsecondary Education. 		5/31/1991
NCES 91191 College-Level Remedial Education in the Fall of 1989
The report will provide information on remedial education offered by institutions of higher education. It will include estimates of remedial/developmental course offering and national estimates of enrollments by race/ethnicity. The data are for the 1989 academic year and are from a sample of about 500 HEGIS institutions. Keywords: postsecondary education; college 		5/24/1991

NCES 91468 Psychometric Report for the NELS:88 Base Year Test Battery

A sample of 9,137 public schools received questionnaires which collected enrollment, # teachers, information on school climate and teacher turnover, racial/ethnic composition of students & teachers, programs and policies of the 1987-88 school year. 		4/8/1991

NCES 91023 CCD Data File: Public Elementary and Secondary School Revenues and Current Expenditures: Fiscal Years 1982-1988 - Final
The data file is produced in SAS and in EBCDIC tape versions. It will contain 7 years of statistical information on Public Elementary and Secondary School Revenues and Current Expenditures: FY82-88. It will contain corrections submitted by SEAs during the period from 10/1/89 - 9/30/90 to the FY 88 data. This will be the last tape in this series because the fiscal data collection was redesigned, expanded and will be known as the "National Public Education Finance Survey" (NPEFS). 		4/2/1991
NCES 91126 CCD Data File: National Public Education Financial Survey: Fiscal Year 1989
The National Public education finance survey provides state and national level information about revenues, expenditures, and average daily attendance (ADA). 		4/2/1991
NCES 91062 Characteristics of the 100 Largest Public Elementary and Secondary School Districts in the United States: 1988-89
This publication provides descriptive information about the 100 largest school districts in the United States in the 1988-89 school year. Almost one in every four public school students in this nation is served by one of these large districts. They are distinguished from smaller districts by characteristics in addition to sheer size, such as pupil-teacher ratios, high school graduates, and minority enrollment as a proportion of total enrollment. 		4/1/1991
NCES 91366 Data File: Faculty Salaries, Tenure and Fringe Benefits in Postsecondary Institutions, 1989-90
Data file from the IPEDS salaries and benefits survey, FY 1990-91 -- contains salaries data of full-time instructional staff. 		3/6/1991

This IPEDS data file contains information on 1989 fall enrollments in postsecondary institutions. 		3/6/1991
NCES 91215 Early Estimates: National Estimates of Postsecondary Education: Collegiate and Noncollegiate, Fall 1990
Early estimates of enrollment and completions in postsecondary institutions for fall 1990, and academic year 1989-90, based on telephone data collection from sampled institutions. This is the second in a series: the first, for higher education institutions, was complete 12/31/90. 		2/28/1991
NCES 91660 Digest of Education Statistics, 1990
The Digest is an annual compendium whose primary purpose is to provide a compilation of statistical information covering the broad field of American education from kindergarten through graduate school. The Digest includes more than 400 tables from many sources, both government and private, and draws especially on the results of surveys and activities caried out by NCES. The publication contains information on a variety of subjects in the field of education including educational attainment, federal funds for education, and numbers of schools, colleges, teachers and students. 		2/15/1991
NCES 91028 CCD Data File: Public Elementary/Secondary School Universe Survey: School Year 1989-90
Computer tapes and documentation for the 1989-90 public school universe. Data are from the CCD Public Elementary/Secondary School Universe, School Year 1989-90. 		2/5/1991
NCES 91029 CCD Data File: Local Education Agency Universe Survey: School Year 1989-90
The Nonfiscal Survey of Public Elementary and Secondary Schools provides information about total student and classroom teacher counts, as well as students by free-lunch eligibility and race/ethnicity for public elementary and secondary schools for the 1989-90 school year. Data were provided by state education agencies (SEAs) from their administrative records. 		2/5/1991
NCES 91345 The Relationship Between Postsecondary & High School Course-taking Patterns: The Preparation of 1980 High School Sophomores Who Entered Postsecondary Institutions by 1984
The general public, policymakers, researchers and special interest groups are interested in the patterns of persistence and change in academic and vocational interests over time using high school and postsecondary transcipt and student data for 1980 high school seniors. Additional questions will be asked about course taking patterns in various academic and vocational subject matter areas. Frequencies and crosstabulations will be used for the data analysis. 		1/2/1991

NCES 90073 State Profiles on Public Elementary and Secondary Education: 1987-88
This publication is one is a series of annual reports presenting education statistical profiles of each State, D.C. and outlying areas. The basic sources are the CCD surveys for school year 1987-88 and fiscal year 1987, including data on schools and education agencies, student membership and graduation, instructional and administrative staff, and revenues and expenditures. Additional sources will include Bureau of Census, CCSSO, and NEA. Audience includes educational research community, Congress, State and other Federal agencies, libraries and news media. 		10/25/1990
NCES 90381 Racial/Ethnic Trends in Degrees Conferred by Higher Education Institutions, 1976-77 through 1986-87
This report presents trend data on the number and types of degrees awarded by higher education institutions by racial/ethnic categories. 		10/19/1990
NCES 91142 A Guide to Improving the National Education Data System
This report represents a voluntary, cooperative effort among the Federal Government, States, and education associations to: identify the most critical needs for education policy information; assess the present capacity fo the national statistical system to address these needs; and provide broad direction for system improvements based on this analysis. 		10/15/1990
NCES 90383 Data File: 1988-89 Completions in Postsecondary Institutions
This IPEDS data file contains data (including racial/ethnic statistics) on completions in postsecondary institutions by level of award and institutional program. 		10/2/1990
NCES 90423 The Nation's Report Card
This report will include an overview and amalgam of the findings from the seven curriculum areas assessments of 1988. It will describe performance for fourth graders and eighth graders in six subject areas -- reading, writing, mathematics, science, history, and civics. For twelfth graders, information will be presented in these six subjects plus a seventh, geography. Additionally, pertinent trends, international comparisons, and information about instructional policy will be synthesized. The report will provide an unprecedented profile for American education to the general public, educators, policymakers, legislators and members of athe executive branches of Government, by assembling complete and accurate NAEP data about the progress of American educational achievement. This synthesis should provide the country with a clear understanding of where we have come from, where we are, and what can be predicted for the future. 		9/26/1990
NCES 90692 Targeted Forecast: Earned Degrees Conferred
Contains projections of earned degrees conferred, by level from 1989-90 to 1994-95. Projections use data from the Earned Degrees Conferred survey. The audience includes policy makers, businesses, the media, and the public. 		9/21/1990
NCES 90686 Targeted Forecast: Public Elementary and Secondary Current Expenditures
Contains projections of public school expenditures from 1989-90 to 1994-95. Projections are based on CCD, DRI, and other data. The audience includes policy makers, businesses, the media, and the public. 		9/21/1990
NCES 90689 Targeted Forecast: Higher Education Enrollment
Contains projections of higher education enrollment, by sex, attendance status, and type and control of institution from 1990 to 1995. Projections are based on IPEDS, Census, and other data. The audience includes policy makers, businesses, the media and the public. 		9/21/1990
NCES 90690 Targeted Forecast: Classroom Teachers
Contains projections of public and private classroom teachers, by organizational level, from 1990 to 1995. Projections are based on CCD, NEA, and other data. The audience includes policy makers, businesses, the media, and the public. 		9/18/1990
NCES 90691 Targeted Forecast: High School Graduates
Contains projections of public and private high school graduates from 1989-90 to 1994-95. Projections are based on CCD, Census, and other data. The audience includes policy makers, businesses, the media, and the public. 		9/18/1990
NCES 90687 Targeted Forecast: Public Elementary and Secondary Teacher Salaries
Contains projections of public school teacher salaries from 1989-90 to 1994-95. Projections are based on NEA and CCD data. The audience includes policy makers, businesses, the media, and the public. 		9/18/1990
NCES 90688 Targeted Forecast: Elementary and Secondary Enrollment
Contains projections of public and private school enrollments, by grade level, from 1990 to 1995. Projections are based on CCD and Census data. The audience includes policy makers, businesses, the media, and the public. 		9/18/1990
NCES 90332 Undergraduate Financial Aid Awards: A Report of the 1987 National Postsecondary Student Aid Study
The primary purpose of this report is to provide information to policymakers and interested parties on how different sources and types of student financial aid are combined to produce a student aid award or package. 		9/15/1990
NCES 90353 Profile of American (U.S.) Students
This report uses NPSAS data to detail the enrollment, demographic, employment, and socioeconomic characteristics of students enrolled in the nation's postsecondary education institutions (1986-87 academic yr). 		9/14/1990
NCES 90659 Dropout Rates in the United States: 1989
This National dropout report, mandated by Congress under P.L. 100-297, will use data from CPS, HS&B, NELS:88, and NHES to report the latest dropout statistics available to NCES. Both dropout and retention rates will be reported in this document which will be presented to Congress on the second Tuesday after Labor Day. Two types of dropout rates, event and status, will be calculated from the October CPS supplement and NHES. A third dropout rate, cohort, will be calculated from HS&B and NELS:88. The HS&B data set will also be used to describe the educational and occupational experiences of individuals who have dropped out of school. At-risk students will be identified through analysis of the NELS:88 data base. 		9/11/1990
NCES 90463 NELS:88 Base Year Sample Design Report
Using all 4 NELS:88 surveys, this technical report will provide a detailed review of the base year sample design, including both school and student selection, construction of the sampling frame, selection procedures, replacement procedures for ineligible and noncooperating schools, and basic weighting procedures. The report is organized into a description of the longitudinal studies program, an overview of the base year study, a detailed description of sample design and implementation, sample weights, unit nonresponse analysis; standard errors and design effects, and an evaluation of the overall sample design. This report will be of interest primarily to researchers and policy analysts who are users of the NELS:88 base year data. 		9/10/1990
NCES 90374 E.D. TAB: Academic Libraries: 1988
Basic tabulations for the IPEDS Academic Libraries survey. Summary tables are presented on expenditures, staff, collections, loans and service provided. 		9/6/1990
NCES 90380 College Costs: Basic Student Charges, 2-Year and 4-Year Institutions 1989-90
This IPEDS-based report has 1989-90 tuition, room and board charges, typical student expenses, and related data in an easy to read format by State and postsecondary institution. 		9/5/1990
NCES 90682 Second Annual Federal Forecasters Conference Proceedings
Contains a summary of the proceedings of the two-day meetings of the Second Annual Federal Forecasters conference held at the Omni Shoreham Hotel in Washinton, DC on September 6-7, 1989. 		8/10/1990
NCES 90662 Federal Funds for Education, FY 1965 - FY 1989
This publication is an annual report of Federal financial support for education. This report is used by education researchers, policy analysts, news media, and businesses. 		8/9/1990
NCES 90459 E.D. TAB: NELS:88: Eighth Graders' Reports of Courses Taken During the 1988 Academic Year by Selected Student Characteristics
Using NELS:88 data, this tabular summary will present data on the courses taken by eighth grade students including math, science, English, history and social studies, vocational and career preparation classes, and specialized classes such as art or music. Coursework will be broken down by a set of classification variables indicating family background, such as SES, race/ethnicity, language use, and parental education using crosstabulation. The audience includes the U.S. Department of Education offices concerned with eighth grade and later education, curriculum and educational research organizations, middle school or junior high school professional groups, guidance counselors, state departments of education, superintendents and principals. 		7/30/1990
NCES 90096 Financial Accounting for Local and State School Systems
Financial Accounting has been designed as a national standard for State Departments of Education to use in reporting financial data and for school districts to use in preparing their comprehensive annual financial reports that are submitted to their respective State Departments of Education. The purpose of the handbook is to ensure that education fiscal data can be reported in a comprehensive and uniform manner. 		7/25/1990
NCES 90087 E.D. TAB: Selected Characteristics of Public and Private School Teachers: 1987-88
Data are derived from the teacher's questionnaires of the schools and staffing survey. The report will give demographic characteristics of teachers, education and experience and salary. 		7/20/1990
NCES 90075 E.D. TAB: Comparisons of Public and Private Schools, SASS:87-88
Data are from the 1988 SASS questionnaire. In addition to broad general coverage for education associations, parents and counselors will find the variables informative. Public and private sector comparisons will be presented on school characteristics (level, size, community type, region); student characteristics (grade level, enrollment, sex, race, outcomes); and programs/services (bilingual, remedial, handicapped, GT, voc/tech, diagnostic, extended day, Chapter I, free lunch) by level, size, type of community region, and minority status of students. 		7/19/1990
NCES 90370 Trends in Minority Enrollments in Higher Education, Fall 1978 - Fall 1988
Report based on 1988 fall enrollment gathered through the IPEDS survey. Data are presented by minority status, sex, institutional control, level and full-time/part-time status. 		7/19/1990
NCES 90349 E.D. TAB: Characteristics of Guaranteed Student Loan (GSL) Recipients
Basic tabulations from the GSL component of the 1987-88 NPSAS survey. 		7/5/1990
NCES 90458 A Profile of the American Eighth Grader: NELS:88 Student Descriptive Summary
The report will highlight some of the general findings of the NELS:88 Base Year survey and is designed to replicate topics from the base year surveys for the cohorts studied in HS&B and NLS-72, but will largely focus on items of greater relevance to this younger cohort. Written for a non-technical audience, it should be of special interest to U.S. Department of Education offices, and professional and policy groups concerned with middle/junior high schooling, researchers, state departments of education, superintendents and principals. The student, parent, teacher, school, and cognitive test results for NELS:88 base year will be analyzed using descriptive statistics and approximately 20 tables. 		6/27/1990
NCES 90351 Trends in Postsecondary Credit Production 1972 and 1980 High School Graduates
Policymakers, curriculum planners, and researchers are interested in the length of time students take to complete milestones in their educational progress and how that has changed over time. This report will compare data from the National Longitudinal Study-1972 high school seniors and the 1980 High School and Beyond senior cohort, using data from the longitudinal studies and from the postsecondary education transcript studies. Trends in time required and credit production will be presented to address questions related to academic progress and how that has changed. Descriptive statistics and crosstabulations will be presented in this short report. 		6/26/1990
NCES 90376 Data File: Institutional Characteristics of Postsecondary Institutions, 1989-90
This IPEDS data file contains basic data on the Nation's postsecondary institutions. The tape contains name, address, tuitions and other information. 		6/26/1990
NCES 90325 Data File: 1988 IPEDS Fall Enrollment Analysis File
This IPEDS Fall Enrollment survey is conducted annually by NCES. This file is a subset of the 1988 data tape produced from that survey and contains racial/ethnic counts. In cases where reported racial/ethnic detail did not add to the total reported enrollment, the difference was distributed in proportion to the reported detail. In some instances, no detail was reported. In these cases, percent distributions reported by similar institutions (level and control) within the institution's State were used to allocate enrollment by racial/ethnic category. 		6/22/1990
NCES 90464 USER'S MANUAL: NELS:88 Base Year Student Component Data File
Using the student and school files from NELS:88, this manual will familiarize data users and researchers with the procedures followed for data collection and processing of the NELS:88 base year survey, and provide necessary documentation for use of the Student data file. Contents will include a descriptive reporting of the study and historical perspective on the longitudinal studies program, information about related studies and data files, a description of data collection instruments, a description of the sample design and implementation, an account of data collection, preparation and processing. In addition, a detailed guide to the data file and codebook will be provided, including information on the construction of the composite variables, guidelines for use of statistical analysis packages, and record layout, as well as presenting the codebook itself and the survey instruments. 		6/22/1990
NCES 90466 USER'S MANUAL: NELS:88 Base Year Parent Component Data File
Using the NELS:88 Base Year Parent Survey, this manual will familiarize data users and researchers with the procedures followed for data collection and processing of the NELS:88 base year survey, and to provide necessary documentation for use of the Parent data file. Contents will include an overview of the study and historical perspective on the longitudinal studies program, information about related studies and data files, a description of data collection instruments, a description of the sample design and implementation, an account of data collection, preparation and processing. In addition, a detailed guide to the data file and codebook will be provided, including information on the construction of the composite variables, guidelines for use of statistical analysis packages and record layout, as well as presenting the codebook itself and the survey and survey instruments. 		6/22/1990
NCES 90658 Who Majors in Science? College Graduates in Science, Engineering, or Mathematics from the High School Class of 1980
This report examines the major fields of study of a representative sample of 1980 high school seniors who had graduated from college by 1986 and compares those who majored in engineering, mathematics, or the natural and physical sciences (about 23.4 percent) with those who majored in other fields. 		6/15/1990
NCES 90681 The Condition of Education, 1990, Vol. 1
The Condition of Education is an annual compendium report to Congress which describes the current status and recent progress of education in the United States. It focuses on 60 indicators, representing a consensus of professional judgment on the most significant national measures of the condition and progress of education at the time, but tempered, necessarily, by the availability of current and valid information. This volume contains a set of indicators covering elemmentary/secondary education. These indicators deal with student performances and outcomes as well as a variety of characteristics of the educational "system." 		5/31/1990

The Condition of Education is an annual compendium report to Congress which describes the current status and recent progress of education in the United States. It focuses on 60 indicators, representing a consensus of professional judgment on the most significant national measures of the condition and progress of education at the time, but tempered, necessarily, by the availability of current and valid information. This volume contains a set of indicators covering postsecondary education. 		5/31/1990

NCES 90085 E.D. TAB: Selected Characteristics of Public and Private School Administrators (Principals): 1987-88

NCES 1990527 A College Course Map and Transcript Files: Changes in Course-Taking and Achievement, 1972-1993. Second Edition.
This document, a byproduct of the National Longitudinal Study of the High School Class of 1972, provides data on what postsecondary courses are actually taken both by school completers and school leavers, based on analysis of postsecondary transcripts from 1972 to 1984 of 12,600 students graduating from high school in 1972. Also presented is a revised Classification of Instructional Programs (CIP) coding system based on recoding the 485,000 instances of course-taking in the sample. The tentative new taxonomy and decision rules were reviewed by faculties in the appropriate fields prior to final application. Data from the study are presented in tabular form and include the following: percentage of students completing undergraduate courses in 1,037 course categories; percentage of students completing undergraduate courses in 103 aggregate course categories; and distribution of all completed courses by type of institution. Additional data presented cover: basic demography and high school backgrounds of students; highest degree earned; college scholarship support; basic demography of 2/4-year and transfer attendance patterns; date of bachelor's degrees; date of associate's degrees; course of study and degrees earned beyond the bachelor's; and college experiences/attainments. (DB) 		4/21/1990
NCES 90093 E.D. TAB: Public Elementary and Secondary Education - Final State Aggregate Data, 1988-89
This ED TAB presents final data by State for teachers, students and graduates for school year 1988-89 and public school revenues and current expenditures for fiscal year 1988. Data are from the CCD State Fiscal and Nonfiscal Surveys. Audience: news media, educational researchers, Congress, State government agencies, education community. 		4/16/1990
NCES 90309 Methodology Report for the National Postsecondary Student Aid Study, 1987
This contractor report uses NPSAS data to explore the characteristics of students who benefit from Federal finanical aid. Adjudication meeting 5/17. 		4/6/1990
NCES 90084 Use of Educational Research and Development Resources by Public School Districts
This report presents the findings from a survey that measures public school districts' attainment and use of research and development resources. Specifically, the publication reports the districts' receipt of materials from the U.S. Department of Education's Office of Educational Research and Improvement (OERI), the districts' receipt of materials from other sources, and the need for additional research and development tools. 		4/3/1990
NCES 90497 The History Report Card
This report will describe trends in levels of history knowledge for eleventh graders between 1986 and 1988 about the people, events and documents of various times, as well as students' understanding of the economic, social, cultural and political context that represent the canvas of our country's history and that influence our lives today. In addition, the report will contain cross-sectional information about the proficiency levels of fourth-, eighth-, and twelfth-grade students regarding both their knowledge and understanding of chronology and of historical events and how these compare for a variety of subpopulations. It will also contain information about the relationships between proficiency levels and various instructional approaches used by teachers, types of course work, topics of study, and demographic factors. The intended audiences are the general public, teachers, and particularly those persons involved in reforms of history curriculum. 		4/2/1990
NCES 90498 The Civics Report Card
This report will describe the achievement of our nation's fourth, eighth, and twelfth graders on reponses to questions about democratic principles as well as about the purposes, structure, and function of government. It will also examine their understanding of the political process and their rights and responsibiities under the law. Cross-sectional results also will be described for various subgroups of students and the relationships between achievement and instructional practices will de detailed. This report will additionally contain trend information for 13- and 17-year-olds about certain aspects of civics, particularly their understanding of democratic principles, the structure and function of government, the electoral process, and the law. These aspects were probed in previous NAEP assessments and those results will be linked to the 1988 data. The report will be prepared for the general public, educators, and officials and leaders interested in civics education. 		4/2/1990
NCES 90098 Services and Resources for Children in Public Libraries, 1988-89
This report presents the findings of the first national survey of public libraries on the services and resources available to children. Survey items include the availability of library resources and services to children, the usage of library services by children, the number of group programs at the library for children and child care-givers, the amount of library cooperation with schools and with preschools or day care centers, and the number and educational level of public service and children's librarians. In March 1989 questionnaires were mailed to a national probability sample of 846 public libraries. The report will be distributed to survey respondents and library associations. This survey on children's services will complement the survey on young adult services (released in July 1988) to be used at the White House Conference on Libraries and Information Science. 		3/28/1990
NCES 90365 1988 National Survey of Postsecondary Faculty (NSOPF-88) Faculty in Higher Education Institutions, 1988
A descriptive report from the 1987-88 National Survey of Postsecondary Faculty. This publicaton will summarize the basic findings of the faculty survey. It will be as non-technical as posssible, but will contain a methodological chapter and present individual standard errors in the data tables and/or contain an appendix presenting generalized standard errors for use with graphs, charts and tables. The publication will also include a brief Executive Summary highlighting major findings. 		3/22/1990

NCES 90346 Patterns and Consequences of Delay in Postsecondary Education
This report describes the patterns of delay in entering 4-year, 2-year, and less than 2-year postsecondary institutions for 1972, 1980 and 1982 high school graduates. Two types of delay were studied: delay in beginning at a particular type of institution, and stopping out for a period of time before returning. 		2/12/1990

NCES 90489 The Writing Trend Cross Sectional Report, 1988
This report will analyze factors related to writing achievement in grades 3, 7, and 11. Based on student self report of background factors, the report will describe the characteristics and attitudes of certain groups of students in relation to how well they can write. It is likely to detail the specific features of writing instruction, how students approach their writing tasks, students writing experiences, and home and school supports to academic achievement. The report is expected to be useful to teachers, principals and writing supervisors intersted in information about good instructional practice. 		1/9/1990

Based on student self support of background factors, the report will describe the characteristics and attitudes of certain groups of students in relation to how well they can read. It is likely to detail the specific features of reading instructions, how students approach their reading tasks, student reading experience, and home and school supports to academic achievement. The report is expected to be useful to teachers, principals and reading supervisors interested in information about good instructional practice. 		1/9/1990

The purpose of this survey is to obtain information from the private schools comparable to that obtained for the public schools, CCD early estimates program. This includes enrollment, number of teachers, and number of high school graduates. The data are being collected through the Private School Universe Project. 		12/29/1989
NCES 90032 Early Estimates: Key Statistics for Public Elementary and Secondary Education: School Year 1989-90
The early estimates in this publication are key statistics reported early in the school year and include the number of students, teachers, and high school graduates, and total revenues and expenditures. These estimates are either preliminary actual counts for individual States, estimates derived by the States for NCES, or imputed values developed by NCES using a combination of State-specific and national data. 		12/29/1989

NCES 89650 The Condition of Education 1989: Volume 1: Elementary and Secondary Education
The Condition of Education is an annual compendium report to Congress which describes the current status and recent progress of education in the United States. It focuses on 60 indicators, representing a consensus of professional judgment on the most significant national measures of the condition and progress of education at the time, but tempered, necessarily, by the availability of current and valid information. The indicators presented in this report touch on many issues in elementary and secondary education. They are discussed under five major headings: (1) school population and support; (2) the teaching profession; (3) school environment; (4) student academic performance; and (5) transitions. 		6/1/1989
NCES 89651 The Condition of Education 1989: Volume 2: Postsecondary Education
The Condition of Education is an annual compendium report to Congress which describes the current status and recent progress of education in the United States. It focuses on 60 indicators, representing a consensus of professional judgment on the most significant national measures of the condition and progress of education at the time, but tempered, necessarily, by the availability of current and valid information. This volume features indicators which provide information concerning the public debate on how higher education institutions spend their money and how much they charge students in tuition and fees. 		6/1/1989

The indicators presented in this report touch on many issues in elementary and secondary education. They are discussed under five major headings: (1) school population and support; (2) the teaching profession; (3) school environment; (4) student academic performance; and (5) transitions. 		6/1/1989
NCES 89062 Characteristics of the 55 Largest Public Elementary and Secondary School Districts in the United States: 1987-88
This publication provides descriptive information about the 55 largest school districts in the United States in the 1987-88 school year. They are distinguished from smaller districts by characteristics in addition to sheer size, such as pupil-teacher ratios, high school graduates, and minority enrollment as a proportion of total enrollment. 		5/1/1989
NCES 89302 College Persistence and Degree Attainment for 1980 High School Graduates: Hazards for Transfers, Stopouts, and Part-Timers
